title: Create a Warehouse
headerText:
Well done, You've taken the first step toward building an Inventory Management solution for your Warehouse.
To get set up, start by creating a Warehouse.
A Warehouse enables you to create Locations and store Inventory

infoArr.title: How to Setup a Warehouse
infoArr.description:
Go to Warehouses.

1. Select create warehouse
2. Fill out the form providing your Warehouse details
3. Select create warehouse

title: Create a Location
headerText:
Good Job, you’ve created a Warehouse.

Now you can populate your warehouse with Locations.

Locations will allow you to store Inventory.

Hint: Start by adding 5 locations. You can add more locations later

infoArr.title: How to Setup a Locations
infoArr.description:
Go to locations.

1. Select create location
2. Select a warehouse from the dropdown menu. The Location will be placed in the selected Warehouse
3. Enter a value for Aisle, *Bay* and Level. This will create a location ID and help you to locate Inventory in your warehouse.
4. Select create location

*required field

title: Print Location Barcodes
headerText:
Each location requires a barcode to be affixed to the corresponding physical location.

Barcodes identify physical locations when using the companion app.

Hint: if you have an established warehouse and your locations already have barcodes affixed to them, you may be able to skip this step.

infoArr.title: How to Print Barcodes
infoArr.description:
Go to locations

1. Select a location
2. Select Print Barcode
3. Select Print Details
4. Print
5. Affix to corresponding physical location

title: Create Inventory
headerText:
Great, You should  have a Warehouse and some locations. 
 Add some inventory to your Warehouse

infoArr.title: How to Setup Inventory
infoArr.description:
Go to Inventory 
 1. Select create item 
 2. Populate the form with the inventory item details
 3. Once complete, select create item

title: Download the App
headerText:
Awesome, You should have a Warehouse, locations and Inventory.

As an alpha or beta user, you should have received an email inviting you to download the companion app: Mercury Handheld (remember to check your junk).

The app is required to process jobs in your warehouse.

Once downloaded onto your device, Login into the app using the same credentials you’ve used to signup here.

If you have not received an email please contact richard.williams@indigo.co.uk

knowledgeBaseInfo.title: Learn more about the Companion App

title: Create Jobs
headerText:
You’re almost set. 

 With the App, you can create or fulfil planned jobs in your warehouse. 

Hint. to ensure your digital warehouse is an accurate reflection of your physical space, go to stock check in the app and start counting your inventory.

infoArr.title: How to Create an Unplanned Job
infoArr.description:
Open Mercury Handheld on your device
 1. Select  Stock Check or other job type
 2. Follow in app instructions

infoArr.title: How to Create a Planned Job
infoArr.description:
Go to Jobs
1. Select create Job
2. Select Job Type
3. Select create Job
4. Complete Create Job form
5. Select create Job 
6. Go to App > Jobs

title: Import Orders
headerText:
Good Work!

Once you are satisfied your digital warehouse is an accurate refection of your physical space. You can start processing orders.

infoArr.title: 1. Download CSV Template
infoArr.description:
Go to Orders

1. Select Import orders
2. Select Download CSV Template
3. Open the .csv document and Map your customer order data to the appropriate columns
4. Export as a .csv file

infoArr.title: 2. How to Import Orders
infoArr.description:
Go to Orders

1. Select Import orders
2. Drag & Drop or choose a .csv file to upload
3. Select validate files
4. Select Import
